intro: Aphyllorchis benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its unique floral structure, featuring a single, showy flower with a distinctive lip. The plant typically grows in high-altitude forest areas, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), adapted to conserve moisture in its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
